article.para: Verifying container images allows you to confirm their provenance, thus ensuring the supply chain security. This chapter provides information on signing and verifying container images.

section.title: Verifying &bci;s with &docker;
section.para: Signatures for images available through &suseregistry; are stored in the Notary. You can verify the signature of a specific image using the following command:
For example, the command docker trust inspect --pretty registry.suse.com/suse/sle15:latest verifies the signature of the latest SLE15 base image.

section.title: Verifying &bci;s with Cosign
section.para: To verify a &bcia;, run Cosign in the container. The command below fetches the signing key from the &suse; server and uses it to verify the latest &bcia;-Base container image.
The signing key can be used to verify all &bcia;s, and it also ships with &productname; (the /usr/share/container-keys/suse-container-key.pem file).

section.title: Verifying &bci;s with &podman;
section.para: Before you can verify &bcia;s using &podman;, you must specify registry.suse.com as the registry for image verification.

note.para: Skip this step on &productname;, as the correct configuration is already in place.

section.para: To do this, add the following configuration to /etc/containers/registries.d/default.yaml:
Instead of editing the default.yaml, you can create a new file in /etc/containers/registries.d/ with a filename of your choice.
Next, modify the /etc/containers/policy.json file. Under the docker attribute, add the registry.suse.com configuration similar to the following:

The specified configuration instructs &podman;, skopeo and &buildah; to verify images under the registry.suse.com repository. This way, &podman; checks the validity of the signature using the specified public key before pulling the image. It rejects the image if the validation fails.

note.para: Do not remove existing entries in transports.docker. Append the entry for registry.suse.com to the list.
This step is optional on &productname;. The signing key is already available in /usr/share/pki/containers/suse-container-key.pem

section.para: &buildah;, &podman; and skopeo automatically verify every image pulled from registry.suse.com from now on. There are no additional steps required.
If verification fails, the command returns an error message as follows:
section.screen: &prompt.user;podman pull registry.suse.com/bci/bci-base:latest Trying to pull registry.suse.com/bci/bci-base:latest... Error: copying system image from manifest list: Source image rejected: Signature for identity registry.suse.com/bci/bci-base is not accepted
section.para: If there are no issues with the signed image and your configuration, you can proceed with using the container image.
